Pixar animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Ben Burtt, Elissa Knight, Jeff Garlin, Fred Willard and Sigourney Weaver.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: Bicentennial Man
programme.desc: A family purchases a robot servant to perform menial tasks but quickly realises this is no ordinary droid when he begins to develop human emotions and the capacity to think for himself, a quality encouraged by his owner's children. He asks for his freedom, and spends the next 200 years struggling to come to terms with its humanity. Chris Columbus's sci-fi drama inspired by the books of Isaac Asimov, starring Robin Williams, Sam Neill, Embeth Davidtz and Oliver Platt.

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman.

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur: Sky Movies Special
programme.desc: Sky Movies takes a special look at Pixar's animated prehistoric adventure.

programme.title: Toys
programme.desc: A dying toy-maker leaves the company to his brother, a power-mad general, who turns the friendly family factory over to the production of weapons. It falls to the general's zany nephew and his equally childlike sister to stand up for their father's benign world-view. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Michael Gambon, Joan Cusack and Donald O'Connor.

programme.title: Maya the Bee Movie
programme.desc: A curious young bee befriends a number of other insects, despite her hive's strict rules on not associating with outsiders. When some of the Queen bee's royal jelly is stolen, she is accused of the crime and needs the help of her friends to track down the real culprits. Animated adventure based on Waldemar Bonsels' children's book, with the voices of Coco Jack Gillies and Kodi Smit-McPhee.

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth.

programme.title: Maya the Bee Movie
programme.desc: A curious young bee befriends a number of other insects, despite her hive's strict rules on not associating with outsiders. When some of the Queen bee's royal jelly is stolen, she is accused of the crime and needs the help of her friends to track down the real culprits. Animated adventure based on Waldemar Bonsels' children's book, with the voices of Coco Jack Gillies and Kodi Smit-McPhee.

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails

Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth.

programme.title: Toys
programme.desc: A dying toy-maker leaves the company to his brother, a power-mad general, who turns the friendly family factory over to the production of weapons. It falls to the general's zany nephew and his equally childlike sister to stand up for their father's benign world-view. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Michael Gambon, Joan Cusack and Donald O'Connor.

programme.title: Kermit's Swamp Years
programme.desc: The fast-talking frog sets out in pursuit of a kidnapper who has abducted his friend. Leaving the safety of his marshland home, he follows a trail that leads him to the bright lights of Hollywood - but he also has to contend with an evil scientist along the way. Muppet comedy adventure, with Christian Kebbel and the voices of Steve Whitmire, Dave Goelz and Bill Baretta.

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver.

programme.title: Problem Child II
programme.desc: Single father Ben Healy with his obnoxious adopted son in tow moves to a new town in search of romance, but ends up with yet another wayward youngster on his hands. Comedy sequel, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Charlene Tilton, and Laraine Newman.

programme.title: Kermit's Swamp Years
programme.desc: The fast-talking frog sets out in pursuit of a kidnapper who has abducted his friend. Leaving the safety of his marshland home, he follows a trail that leads him to the bright lights of Hollywood - but he also has to contend with an evil scientist along the way. Muppet comedy adventure, with Christian Kebbel and the voices of Steve Whitmire, Dave Goelz and Bill Baretta.

programme.title: Surf's Up
programme.desc: A penguin longs to follow in the footsteps of his hero, legendary surfer Big Z, and leaves his Antarctic home to compete in a prestigious tournament on a tropical island. Unfortunately the waves in this warmer climate are much bigger than anything he has experienced - and the egotistical reigning champion does not take kindly to competition. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jeff Bridges and Shia LaBeouf.

programme.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: A girl grows up in 16th-century Europe under the iron fist of her stepmother, until the love of handsome Prince Henry offers a glimmer of hope. Unfortunately, the royal gent has worries of his own in the shape of an arranged marriage. Luckily, Renaissance genius Leonardo da Vinci is on hand to play fairy godfather and bring the pair together. Romantic drama, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott and Timothy West.

programme.title: Dino Time
programme.desc: Three children accidentally activate a time-travel device which transports them 65 million years back in time, where they are protected by a friendly dinosaur. But can they find a way to return to the 21st century while steering clear of all sorts of prehistoric dangers? Animation, featuring the voices of Melanie Griffith, Pamela Adlon and Tara Strong.

programme.title: Survive the Serengeti: Against the Wild 2
programme.desc: When their plane crash-lands in the African bush, two bickering siblings find themselves force to rely on their wits - and their courageous dog - to help them conquer their fears and survive. Adventure, starring Jeri Ryan, John Paul Ruttan and Ella Ballentine.

programme.title: The Sorcerer's Apprentice
programme.desc: A wizard living secretly in modern-day New York vows to prevent his mystical enemy from taking over the city. Realising that he is unable to complete the task alone, he recruits an ordinary teenager to be his assistant, teaching him to master the magical arts. Fantasy adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Jay Baruchel and Alfred Molina.

programme.title: The Muppets
programme.desc: Three fans of the famous puppet variety show discover a powerful businessman is going to knock down the Muppet theatre and drill for oil on the site. They track down frontman Kermit the frog and persuade him to reunite his co-stars, so they can put on one last performance to save the venue. Comedy, starring Jason Segel, Amy Adams and Chris Cooper, with songs by Bret McKenzie (Flight of the Conchords).

programme.title: Dino Time
programme.desc: Three children accidentally activate a time-travel device which transports them 65 million years back in time, where they are protected by a friendly dinosaur. But can they find a way to return to the 21st century while steering clear of all sorts of prehistoric dangers? Animation, featuring the voices of Melanie Griffith, Pamela Adlon and Tara Strong.

programme.title: Survive the Serengeti: Against the Wild 2
programme.desc: When their plane crash-lands in the African bush, two bickering siblings find themselves force to rely on their wits - and their courageous dog - to help them conquer their fears and survive. Adventure, starring Jeri Ryan, John Paul Ruttan and Ella Ballentine.

Unfortunately, the royal gent has worries of his own in the shape of an arranged marriage. Luckily, Renaissance genius Leonardo da Vinci is on hand to play fairy godfather and bring the pair together. Romantic drama, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott and Timothy West.

programme.title: Stone of Destiny
programme.desc: Four students in 1950s Glasgow hatch a plan to inspire a little national pride by breaking into Westminster Abbey and stealing the Stone of Scone, an important Scottish historical relic that has been held on English soil since the Middle Ages, and returning it to its own country. Fact-based comedy, starring Charlie Cox, Kate Mara, Billy Boyd and Robert Carlyle.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bumbling, short-sighted senior citizen unwittingly ends up in the possession of a valuable jewel during a mix-up at a museum exhibition, and is blissfully unaware that a Brazilian crime lord, a female cat burglar and the FBI are on his tail. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, Malcolm McDowell, Ernie Hudson and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Surf's Up
programme.desc: A penguin longs to follow in the footsteps of his hero, legendary surfer Big Z, and leaves his Antarctic home to compete in a prestigious tournament on a tropical island. Unfortunately the waves in this warmer climate are much bigger than anything he has experienced - and the egotistical reigning champion does not take kindly to competition. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jeff Bridges and Shia LaBeouf.(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Big Hero 6 Special
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits Disney studios to go behind the scenes of the animated adventure about a boy and his robot who join a team of superheroes.(n)

programme.title: Frog Games
programme.desc: The king of the land of frogs announces a major sporting event, with the promise that the overall champion will marry his daughter. The horrified princess runs away form home and disguises herself as a commoner, planning to enter the games herself and win - but she gets mixed up in the plans of an evil snake. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bella Thorne and Cameron Dallas.(n)

programme.title: A Warrior's Tail
programme.desc: A boy escapes when his village comes under attack by a pack of hyenas, and goes to get help. He meets a magical white wolf, who leads him on a journey in search of a magician who can help them find a powerful warrior - but many danger's lie between them and the sorcerer's mountain home. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Milla Jovovich, Whoopi Goldberg and Sharon Stone.(n)

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Penniless Charlie Bucket is one of five lucky children who find a golden ticket in a chocolate bar, winning a once-in-a-lifetime tour of eccentric recluse Willy Wonka's magical sweet company. Unfortunately, the other winners each face a grim fate when they start to misbehave. Tim Burton's children's fantasy, based on Roald Dahl's novel, starring Johnny Depp, Freddie Highmore, Helena Bonham Carter, and Deep Roy playing all the Oompa Loompas.(n)

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: A gifted youngster is packed off by her selfish parents to the prison-like Crunchem Hall School. Once there, she befriends a sweet-natured teacher who convinces her that not all grown-ups are bad - and urges her to use her special powers to turn the tables on the nasty headmistress. Fantasy comedy, adapted from the children's book by Roald Dahl, with Mara Wilson, Pam Ferris, Embeth Davidtz, Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: Frog Games
programme.desc: The king of the land of frogs announces a major sporting event, with the promise that the overall champion will marry his daughter. The horrified princess runs away form home and disguises herself as a commoner, planning to enter the games herself and win - but she gets mixed up in the plans of an evil snake. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bella Thorne and Cameron Dallas.(n)

Animated fantasy, with the voices of Milla Jovovich, Whoopi Goldberg and Sharon Stone.(n)
